data.title: Pop Years 1976-2013 compilations
data.meta_description: Amazingly, the Thompson Twins kept having minor hits up to the end of 1991, even though neither the 1989 or 1991 albums on Warner Bros made the Top 100. I...
data.text:
Amazingly, the Thompson Twins kept having minor hits up to the end of 1991, even though neither the 1989 or 1991 albums on Warner Bros made the Top 100. I was shocked when Close To The Bone (the 1987 album which has Get That Love) debuted at #90. True, they'd been on the slide even in 1985, but to go from three top 5 albums to a #90 was a bit drastic. It's a great album actually, better than Heres To Future Days but not quite another Into The Gap (although several songs evoke the same classic pop vibe). The best song on it, Dancing In Your Shoes, was wasted as a B-side to the 2nd single Long Goodbye.

If you're still having trouble making Disc 2's for '83-95, Now Music released CDs for their anniversary that were yearly themed. They have ones for 1983 to 1995, they might help you out. http://destinyxnowmusic.freehostia.com/nowmusic/nowukmenu.html check them out here, just scroll down the main series. They also did a similar collection called "The Mellenium Years" which go back to 1980, a great help when I did my yearly themed playlists.

Here is my 2012 disc:

2. Florence + The Machine - Spectrum (Calvin Harris Remix)

3. Taylor Swift - We Are Never Ever Getting Back Together

If you're still having trouble making Disc 2's for '83-95, Now Music released CDs for their anniversary that were yearly themed. They have ones for 1983 to 1995, they might help you out. http://destinyxnowmusic.freehostia.com/nowmusic/nowukmenu.html check them out here, just scroll down the main series. They also did a similar collection called "The Mellenium Years" which go back to 1980, a great help when I did my yearly themed playlists.

Also, Demon Music's Pop Years 2CD sets for the 70s, 80s and 90s are an excellent reference.

Thanks guys! Funnily enough I have most of the Pop Years compilations / NOW yearly series and they have come in very useful for edited versions of these songs. HITS albums have also come in useful in the 80s. I didn't get the 70s pop years discs as the songs didn't seem very good or even particularly important hits.

I need to get the rest of the original NOW years from the original 1993 series, although I don't think the tracklisting is hugely different from the cheaper Millenium series.

They have ones for 1983 to 1995, they might help you out. http://destinyxnowmusic.freehostia.com/nowmusic/nowukmenu.html

This is a useful link to fill in the gaps in my NOW collection thanks. I thought NOW Dance 86 was on CD for a moment! Gutted I only have it on cassette.

I am determined to finalise 2004-2012 and then start in earnest on disc 2 for each year. This thread will definitely help!

Eric your impeccable taste is required in the PJ Song Contest Thread!

Inevitably, I went and redid my 1986 set once I'd listened back to it again. It didn't feel right. Now it does! Somehow two of my faves, OMD and a-ha, had been left out, so they're in and a couple of the AOR tracks are gone.

I imagine one or two tracks would change depending on what day of the week it is! I know I will never get a perfect list....

2004

01 What You Waiting For Gwen Stefani

02 Toxic Britney Spears

03 Leave (Get Out) Jojo

04 Thank You Jamelia

05 Left Outside Alone Anastacia

06 In The Shadows The Rasmus

07 Take Me Out Franz Ferdinand

08 Somebody Told Me The Killers

09 I Don't Want To Be Gavin DeGraw

10 Run Snow Patrol

11 Mary Scissor Sisters

18 Milkshake Kelis

19 Flawless (Go To The City) George Michael

20 Call On Me Eric Prydz

21 I Believe In You Kylie Minogue

I've not finished 2004 yet but I share the following so far:

02 Toxic Britney Spears

07 Take Me Out Franz Ferdinand

10 Run Snow Patrol

16 These Words Natasha Bedingfield

20 Call On Me Eric Prydz

21 I Believe In You Kylie Minogue

I couldn't decide between Mr Brightside and Somebody Told Me as I didn't know what was bigger but seeing your playlist I'll go for the latter.

CD1

CD2

20. Maverick Sabre - Let Me Go

I was even considering "All These Things That I've Done" whicch I rather like. Not sure it matters which was the bigger single as the album was very successful so I would just go with your favourite!

My 2004 list is very album artist heavy with Scissor Sisters, Killers, Joss Stone, Keane, Franz Ferdinand, Snow Patrol, Damien Rice and Maroon 5 but the best selling singles that year were atrocious!

Looks like I have some work to do on a 2011 list! Looks good. We are probably going to meet in the middle around 2007 or so at this rate!

Wot no Girls Aloud?!

I do rather like "The Show" and "Love Machine" but I don't see them as essential 2004 songs. I know that is a popjustice crime, sorry.
